This will cause path monitoring to restart on the newly targeted interface and may cause a short blip in raw data and/or alert profiles as a result.

get.summary: Retrieve top N conversations
get.description: Returns top N conversations by port and protocol of various types by either traffic volume, traffic rate, number of packets, or number of flows for a specified time period.  A current limitation of Top Conversations is that each conversation returned represents the traffic in only one direction, hence both directions may not be represented in the list returned.  AppNeta appliances running FlowView upload the collected flow data at five-minute intervals (e.g. at 01:00, 01:05, 01:10). The FlowView data is also stored and labelled with these five-minute intervals. The time that the five-minute interval of flow data is stored indicates the beginning of the interval.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: appliance id

parameters.name: interface
parameters.description: capture interface name

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: metric by which the top N conversations are ordered by. Optional. Default is bytes

parameters.name: n
parameters.description: number of conversations to return (max 512). Optional. Default is 10.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: timestamp in Unix time (seconds since midnight UTC of January 1, 1970). Optional. Default is "now".  Use a 5-minute interval 5 minutes before your required "to" time.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: timestamp in Unix time (seconds since midnight UTC of January 1, 1970). Optional. Default is last hour.

parameters.name: endpoint
parameters.description: endpoint filter criteria as a comma separated list of  "[src|dst] {IP|hostname|IP subnet|IP wildcard}".

parameters.name: endpointMatch
parameters.description: endpoint filter match type: ANY, ALL and NOT.  Optional. Default is ANY.

parameters.name: application
parameters.description: application filter criteria as a comma separated list of application IDs.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: application filter criteria as a comma separated list of categories.

parameters.name: classification
parameters.description: application filter criteria as a comma separated list of classifications.

parameters.name: hostnames
parameters.description: enable reverse DNS hostname resolution for private and/or public IP addresses. Valid values are: private and public. To enable for both types, set as a comma-separated list: private,public. If not specified, hostnames are not determined for IP addresses.

500.description: if the request couldn't be completed due to an unexpected failure (retryable)

400.description: if an invalid parameter is detected or a required parameter is missing

404.description: if the host/interface specified by the request URI can't be found or there's no flow data for the requested time interval

get.description: Returns top N applications.  AppNeta appliances running FlowView upload the collected flow data at five-minute intervals (e.g. at 01:00, 01:05, 01:10). The FlowView data is also stored and labelled with these five-minute intervals. The time that the five-minute interval of flow data is stored indicates the beginning of the interval.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: appliance id

parameters.name: interface
parameters.description: capture interface name

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: metric by which the top N applications are ordered by. Optional. Default is bytes

parameters.name: n

parameters.name: from

parameters.name: endpoint
parameters.description: endpoint filter criteria as a comma separated list of  "[src|dst] {IP|hostname|IP subnet|IP wildcard}".

parameters.name: endpointMatch

id.description: Unique ID for the Network Path

target.description: The IP address or FQDN of the network path target

monitoringEnabled.description: True: monitoring is enabled; False: monitoring is disabled

monitoringStatus.description:
Monitoring status of the network path. Possible values include:
  • DISABLED: Monitoring is Disabled.
  • MONITORING: Monitoring is active (when monitoring is enabled).
  • POLICY_MISMATCH: No longer meeting the criteria in the monitoring policy. Monitoring will resume when the criteria are met (when monitoring is enabled).
  • MP_OFFLINE: Source Monitoring Point has not contacted AppNeta in the last 5 minutes (when monitoring is enabled).
  • MONITORING_FAILED: Monitoring failed because of AppNeta internal errors (when monitoring is enabled).

dualEnded.description:
True : outbound (to target) and inbound (from target) metrics are available
False : only round-trip metrics are available
